thread.title: Georgia gets good news on OL
thread.title_full: Georgia gets good news on OL

title: Georgia gets good news on OL
text:
Georgia gets good news on OL On Monday, the Bulldogs got the news they were hoping for.   (Photo: Chris Collins, 247Sports) 
Playing freshman interior offensive lineman Solomon Kindley on a third-and-short against Missouri last season will not come back to haunt Georgia. On Monday, per Marc Weiszer at the Athens Banner-Herald , the school confirmed that Kindley has been granted a redshirt, and will have four years of eligibility remaining. Not a member? Try a seven-day FREE trial to VIP access to Dawgs247! 
Kindley did not see the field after that play and the 6-foot-4, 336-pound lineman battled injuries the rest of the season. 
“We’re basically looking into all those with him to hopefully get it back,” Smart said last fall. “But to be honest with you, if he’s a really good player down the road like we think he will be then he may not play that next year anyway.” 
“In retrospect, you can look back and say, ‘Why did you play him?’” Smart said. “But I guess at that point in time it was the third game of the year, it was a situation where we thought surely he’d play more throughout the year.” 
Kindley will likely compete with Pat Allen and Dyshon Sims for the starting right guard position this season. 
(What's next for the Bulldogs? Make sure you're in the loop -- take a few moments to sign up for our FREE Bulldogs Newsletter! ) Author
